title: Completely impossible to interact
body: After being told by my GP I  need an appointment with the pharmacy group I tried ANIMA. This is impossible to make an appointment and no othet option for message for pharmacy team. I then tried twice and left two messages on telephone and no response. Contacted reception and they just re direct you to ANIMA, which I explained didn't work for this, so they said to hang up, redial and press 6 - which I had already done, twice. Totally impossible situation, I assume just to make you give up and stop bothering them. I still don't have the required appointment.

author: lizm
title: Need for aftercare following gynaecology procedure
body:
I had a procedure to remove a small polyp. Whilst the nurse and consultant were absolutely great, doing their level best to make it as quick and painless as possible, the after care was severely lacking.  
As I attempted to leave the building I was in such excruciating pain I was disorientated and I could barely walk. I had to lean on my husband at the main entrance door to stop me passing out. On the way home in the car I wanted to be sick and almost passed out again. When I got home I was crawling to the bathroom because I couldn't stand.  
With no after care leaflet or any kind of information about what to expect other than bleeding, I tried to contact the outpatient department for advice but no one was available. I had no choice but to phone NHS 24. Finally at 8pm, I spoke to an excellent doctor who thought that my symptoms might be related to some other underlying pelvic issue because of the severity.  
My complaint is that without aftercare advice and not knowing who to contact if unsure, your pain and anxiety worsens. I got more aftercare after all my Covid vaccinations! Perhaps it would be a good idea to have a post-procedure seating area just in case patients do react badly.  
Thank goodness someone was with me to drive. I was in no fit state. And no one even asked me how I was getting home either. As I said, the consultant and nurse were excellent but post-procedure needs more thought and attention.

author: UBfamily
title: Sensitive and gentle nursing from ward 17 team
body:
Yesterday my 89 year-old mother passed away in ward 17 of Monklands University Hospital. Her final days were spent in a frame of mind that was calm and accepting.  
This was a blessing for Mum and for all of the family and came about, in no small way, due to the remarkable care and attention that she received from the nursing staff in ward 17.  
Mum immediately felt safe in the ward as she had been admitted to Monklands before and had always had a very positive experience.  
She was in ward 17 for 10 days and was cared for by a number of nurses, including Pauline, Lauren, Melissa, Lisa and Angela, all of whom were so helpful and genuinely caring.  
I know that the ward, like every other in the NHS, was short staffed, but I only know this because I was told - there was no evidence of it in the sensitive and gentle nursing that Mum received.  
I commend and thank everyone involved from the bottom of my heart.

author: BlueNightSky
title: A wonderful and talented bunch
body: My son badly broke his arm recently which needed a trip to A&E, an overnight stay in the Children's Hospital, Ward 29 and then an operation the following day. Without exception, the doctors, porters, play specialist, nurses, receptionist, were fantastic and made his stay as good as it could be given the circumstances. They were all extremely kind, thoughtful and attentive and nothing felt like too much trouble. They all spoke directly to my son where appropriate and I know that he felt heard and respected. I just really wanted to say a heartfelt thank you, you are a wonderful/talented bunch of people.

author: birthdaygirl100
title: All the staff were delightful
body:
I wanted to thank the NHS, the staff and the physio department for looking after an old lady. I broke my pelvis and spent 15 days in hospital and was looked after marvellously. All the staff are and were delightful for me. They arranged for 2 lovely physiotherapists to visit me during my stay. The hospital arranged for me to go to a convalescence home where the physiotherapists visited me and helped me with exercises.  
I was discharged home last week and the ladies have visited giving me further information and exercises, these have helped me to recover although somewhat limited. I do live in a first floor flat with 18 steps to climb so that in itself is therapy. I just wanted to thank each and every one of you that has supported me, given me information, you are invaluable.  
On another note I used to attend sessions with the balance team, these stopped due to covid but I found them extremely useful and if they were to start again I would be delighted to attend.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very poor services
body:
I came to your services for help in my recovery process but instead I'm now finding myself even more damaged by how your workers  have treated myself and others.
We don't get helped, we get told we're too complex instead, we also get accused of attention seeking and much more after opening up to questions that have been asked. 
You make broken people feel even more broken somehow, you've made me lose every bit of hope in getting better. 
Because if I'm too complex for professionals then what hope do I have in trying to get better. 
I wouldn't say I was complex, I would say my mind is too open, in fact I had to educate some of your support workers because apparently they haven't been educated enough to know about real mental health conditions. 

I feel like I wasn't listened to, the work wasn't followed through by your staff.
I was constantly having to defend myself because of the narrow mindedness of your staff to the point they made me feel more ashamed then what I started. 
Not only have the added more issues to my mental health but they've also added more insecurity in to me due to the remarks and comments made about me which were very inappropriate. 
I am actually devastated not just for myself but also for others that have been treated like this and now I just suffer in silence because reaching out got me nowhere apart from being insulted and made to feel even more worthless.

author: Lulnp33
title: Appalling care in A & E
body:
I went in with ligament damage to my knee. The waiting time displayed was 2.5 hours this is not accurate or updated as I waited 4 hours before I was seen. I found the receptionists to be rude and unsupportive of the pain patients are in or their individual circumstances. In the short period I was there 3 patients walked out due to excessive waiting times and poor quality care.  
I also observed:  
1. The staff lost people's hospital notes2. Staff joked about their finishing times despite a waiting room fall of people3. Staff openly checked their phones in front of patients in the waiting room, purchased red bull joking about how tired they felt.4. Nurses discussed patients after they left5. After waiting nearly 3.5 hours to be seen the doctor did not check, feel, examine my knee which I find shocking instead I was told to go and see my gp. 6. Nurses spent more time losing and looking for equipment as opposed to treating patients Overall the hospital service and care shown to patients was appalling. I would not visit this hospital again as it was deeply disappointing

author: Charlotte Webb
title: Excellent health care
body: At Meadowgreen surgery I have always received the best of care by everyone from Receptionists/secretaries though to all clinicians. Courteous, caring and excellent at their jobs

readBy.name: Meadowgreen Health Centre & The Avenue Medical Practice

author: Sincis3
title: Fantastic advice and excellent care in A & E
body:
Phoned NHS 24 as I had a severe head injury and needed advice, The call handler John from Aurora was just lovely and patient, while Anne-Marie the nurse from Aurora was so professional.  
I was assessed and treated quickly and efficiently and cannot fault my care, including excellent support at QUEH A & E.  
Thank goodness for the NHS.

author: Len1959
title: They are brilliant and I now feel brilliant.
body:
I’m 36. I’ve been drinking for 22 years through many issues including mental health. I have been to Thurrock inclusions many times and have detoxed and relapsed. They have never turned their back on me and have now given me another chance. I got my key worker back, Kelly, who said she will help me if I help myself. I was binge drinking everyday and going to inclusions groups and meeting all the other staff. Going to the groups has reduced my alcohol dependency.  
I stopped the binge drinking. Every meeting I go to has helped me in every way. They have got me detoxed in a rehab and am doing many other recovery groups. Everyone there are absolutely brilliant they have saved my life. I could never thank them so much - they are brilliant and I now feel brilliant.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The best nurses I have ever come across
body:
I came to Lurgan on Wednesday for a 4 hour consultation and I’ve been here since. The food is outstanding considering some other hospital food it has definitely been the best. The nurses are incredible and I am not being flattering when I say that they are the best I have ever come across without a shadow of a doubt.  
I have been in hospital in England and it cannot even compare to care I am getting in Lurgan. The nurses also have a great relationships among themselves - no task ever seems too big. They never have a bother doing anything. I would not make any changes at all I am receiving a superb service.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Positive Experience
body: I was attended by very friendly and caring staff who put me at ease and the clinician made me feel very comfortable during my appointment. Thank you to all staff at Cumberland House!

title: Great service
body: They gave me a really good service and support towards the months of progress. The dermatologist I had gave me a clear understanding of all of it.

author: Rosie@31
title: Today I have witnessed real nursing care
body:
I am an inpatient in Daisy Hill Hospital in Newry on level 5 Medical Ward. he Ward is extremely busy with very ill patients some of whom at times, can be confused and aggressive.  
The staff are completely run of their feet, they are so attentive and friendly despite the look of exhaustion on their faces. I want to mention in particular a third year student Chloe who is doing her management and a staff nurse Susan both of whom have showed their skills of compassion and caring, because despite the crazy business of the ward they sat and fed all the elderly patients, ensuring they were hydrated. They sat and chatted to those who needed reassurance or just a friendly ear. In the middle of all the essential nursing Susan found the time to get on her knees wash an elderly mans feet and cut his toe nails and she painted an elderly woman’s fingernails. Today I have witnessed real nursing care, a credit to Daisy Hill Hospital nursing staff.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: pmcall1608
title: Overall a very pleasant experience.
body:
The NISTAR team transferred our 8 week old girl from Daisy Hill Hospital in Newry to The Royal Belfast Children's Hospital. Cant remember the nurses name but she was very friendly and reassuring and made us feel very comfortable about the whole process. She provided her phone number to us and she also took our phone number and promised to ring us should there be any problems during the transfer.  
The NISTAR team then transferred her on to Crumlin Children's Hospital in Dublin. Our nurse for that trip was Natasha, again she was very friendly and reassuring and couldn’t have been more helpful. Both nurses also updated us on how she was during the transfer and it was overall a very pleasant experience.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Bad service
body: I asked for a morning phone call due to work restraints. Only to be told doctor was running over. It takes at least three days to get a reply to an e consult, then you can’t have your phonecall at the requested time. Terrible service, it’s like GP’s are a protected species and patients don’t matter at all.

title: Try getting an appointment
body: The booking system is a joke! I work full time and have 5 children. I can’t login at 8am to get an appointment I need to be able to make an appointment when I remember to. I’m commuting, getting ready for the meetings that day, running around after kids at 8am!! Unless it’s an emergency I would never have the time to attempt to book an appointment online at 8am. I’ve been with these drs all my life and I have seen a gradual decline in care over the last few years as the established drs have retired and new ones have come in. Disappointing

title: Superb, dedicated knowledgeable friendly.
body: Went in for an appendectomy, the staff were friendly, knowledgeable, and dedicated, informed me about the risks, and the hospital was scrupulously clean, the NHS get a bad press, but from what I saw today if more hospitals were as well staffed as The Cumberland Infirmary, the the NHS would be the envy of the world.

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: Laura Lincoln
title: I am so pleased about the care and treatment my son received
body:
My son (age 12) was well looked after by the team. I think his therapist was called Leanne. She did a brilliant job of diagnosing the issue, giving him exercises to do and then monitoring his progress. She spoke to him in a patient and understanding way, listened really well, and helped him to feel at ease. She made him feel like he mattered and made a huge difference to his health.  
I am so pleased about the care and treatment my son received, and so grateful to the NHS.

title: Great Nursing Care
body: I wish to thank the entire Peatree Lane and Moors Walk Nursing Team for the excellent care provided to me from January until May following a minor procedure. The whole team are a credit to the practice and the NHS.

title: Great service
body:
Having joined this practice a few months ago after not being satisfied with my previous surgery, the treatment and contact /support I have received has been fantastic. I have had more contact with a GP and a more in depth chat/tests than I have in a long time. 
Even with the telephone appointments it’s been very helpful and I am appreciative of the GP’s and reception staff I have spoken to on the 2 occasions that I have needed. Thank you. Highly recommend.

title: Unbelievable waiting times
body: What a waste of time. First you're waiting an hour till someone calls your name. Then they take you to another room where you are waiting another 3+ hours. Was waiting for nearly 4 hours to be seen. As they started to ferry people into the next waiting area no one was being seen. Honestly a joke, And very distressing when they tell you you can't bring your partner, so you're waiting on your own. And then let's add on that car parking bill. A better solution would be to go in, give them your number and go home and wait to be called into the hospital. You might as well call the department "accident" because if its an emergency you better go somewhere else. The other annoying part is here the receptionist tell someone that it also goes by priority, sorry but after waiting 4 hours priority shouldn't be a thing, 4 hours is now priority

author: Communication Matters
title: Mum and I had such a good experience
body:
My mum has dementia and last week had an unwitnessed fall in her Care Home and was admitted to Daisy Hill Emergency Department. Nurse Sinead, who was on night duty, listened to all of my mum's fears and concerns and was so kind, patient and reassuring. My mum was was thoroughly investigated and an underlying problem identified which required surgical intervention in Craigavon Hospital. The senior doctor in the department took time to speak to me and explain the plan he was putting in place. I left the department feeling my mum was safe and the care was excellent.  
Mum was transferred to Craigavon Hospital, Ward 4 South where she was treated with dignity, respect and compassion. She was spoken to clearly, reassured and at all times was so well cared for. Thank you Sister Ashlene, and thank you to all the Nursing, Medical and Support staff who took time to chat to my mum, explain in terms that she could understand what was happening and who kept me engaged and involved in her care. I was so delighted to received regular updates from the ward by telephone without prompt. I cannot thank you enough. You collectively made a very distressing situation so much easier to navigate through. Thank you for facilitating my hospital visits and allowing me to support my mum with her evening meal.  
I just wanted to say that it was a pleasure to hear gentle laughter on the ward and witness a strong team ethos. The friendly ward atmosphere created such a lovely ward environment for patients and staff alike. You all should be really proud.  
At the change of shift two members of the team called out "bye bye" to my mum as they were leaving the ward. They called her by her first name and I asked my mum who they were. She said they are my friends, and are such lovely girls. Mum was so happy during her stay despite being in a strange environment.  
I felt my mum was safe in 4 South and that she was receiving the best care possible. The Team knew her dementia diagnosis and used this in a positive way to ensure she was as engaged as she could be in her care. The medical and nursing staff took time to listen to my concerns and walk me through the plan for mums care. My mums care was person centered. Her likes and dislikes were considered. The ward was busy and yet at no stage did I feel communication or care was rushed. Everyone was just so pleasant and caring. Mum and I had such a good experience. Thank You all so very much.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent care given to my mother today
body:
Thank you to the Admin Team for sorting a timely appt  for my Mother today! The nurse  was fantastic; both kind and professional. 
We were treated with the utmost courtesy and respect by ALL members of the Holmwood team!   Thank you.

title: Great service
body: Quick efficient and kept child distracted to what was about to occur .the nurses were nice and friendly.

title: Excellent Experience
body: I have recently been seen by the nurse who always manages to extract blood from me, hospital staff always struggle.  Blood test result was extremely fast coming back to me and the doctor I spoke to about those and other results was very understanding and never rushed me in explaining things to me.  I have recently also spoken to the physio lady that the surgery also has available now and she was very knowledgeable about my sciatica.  I hope the surgery continues to treat their patients as people and not numbers.

author: Paula24
title: Thank you for making what could have been a stressful visit so much easier
body:
At the end of May we had to attend Wishaw A&E with my young nephew as he had injured his ankle and couldn’t weight bear. He was on the expects list & the receptionist Rachel picked up the alert right away that he was autistic. She offered to let my sister wait in the car until they were ready for him & she would call her to save him getting distressed.  
Fortunately minor injuries did not have many waiting and he was assessed, x-rayed & discharged within 45 minutes. From the reception staff, medical & nursing staff and radiology the care and understanding was amazing. Thank you so much for making what could have been a very stressful visit for them much easier.

author: FGH38
title: Unsatisfactory language used in appointment letters
body:
I echo several other stories here in saying how unsatisfactory the language used is in appointment letters.  
I attended the Dermatology department for what I thought was a review with my doctor, and instead found was an appointment for routine bloods which I could have arranged at my GP at a time convenient to me.  
My appointment was titled, BAU Contingency Treatment Diary SCH, which means nothing to me.  
Between receiving this appointment letter and attending the appointment, I received a separate letter requesting I arrange blood tests either with my GP or by phoning the department.  
This is unnecessarily confusing and unhelpful. I note the change to the wording has been planned for a year, according to this site.  
(Please note the staff and the service are excellent)

title: The Worst GP service
body:
I don’t want to make a complain about the average 40-50 minutes queue time over phone appointments. But according to appointment allocations this is the worst GP in my whole UK life. 

My wife is Pregnant for 14 weeks now. We tried to get an appointment from last 3 weeks to see a doctor or mid wives to initial check up and conditions, as she have some morning sicknesses. 

Initially they said they booked phone appointment foe Monday 16th May 2022. Between 9am-1pm. But nobody call us as we waited for full day. 

Later we contacted GP again, they did not have any clue, they said they did not have any information about the appointment. And booked again Mid wives appointment for next Monday  23th May 2022. 
Between 9am -1pm. 

Repeated story again, we waited for whole day but nobody called us to follow up. 

Later we contacted again to GP and they told us they don’t have access to mid wives, therefore, gave us a hospital number, however hospital told us they don’t accept the personal call rather then GP forward the case for routine appointment. 

Now, we are in a puzzle situation, in between GP, Mid wives and Hospital. No idea what to do. 
We don’t really know when this “Tom and Jerry” game will stop. 

We could say this is Frustrating, Disappointing and misleading what hampering our mental and physical health as well as our personal and family life.

title: No response. Continuously put on hold
body: I'm a dialysis patient, and it's a nightmare trying to get hold of the doctor. Also getting medicine on time has become a major struggle. Today had an inquiry about my elevated blood pressure was put on hold for half hour the three times I rang. Never got through. Pathetic service. I fear for my well being.

title: Great care
body: I would like to say a big thank you to all the staff involved in my care when I recently stayed at the Cuckmere ward at the  DGH due to dysphagia and hypoglycemia. You did a great job in looking after me and caring for me. This was the 3rd time I had to go to hospital in 4 months due to not being unable to swallow. A big thank you to you all in making me feel better.

title: Superb service
body: I could not have had better treatment from any of the staff, from my surgeon to the cleaner, friendly, efficient, kind and extremely top quality service.

title: Thank you NHS
body:
Just like to say a big thank you to the surgeons and their team along with all the nurses on Chesterman department 4, 
E ward for the care shown to me during my recent surgery followed by a 10 day stay, the whole experience was excellent from the pain management to the care and consideration shown to me during my time recovering, without exception you were truly professional in every aspect of my care. What would we do without you.
Once again thank you.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Annderee
title: Keep up the good work
body:
Many thanks to Ruth , Danielle, Tamzin, Catherine and Aishling for the excellent care I received last week in Day Procedure Unit in County Hospital Omagh  
.  
Keep up the good work girls .  
Many Thanks

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

title: Told couldn't be treated
body: Husband fell 2 wks ago. Now in some pain in arm. Think bone chipped or broken. Was sent by 111 to this Corby care. Never been to Corby before so got lost and took ages to find. Booked in then reception came and told my husband that he couldn't been seen cos only 1 person on and they couldn't look at his problem. Told to come back tomorrow or Saturday. Really. Had to make way home. Will not go back. Awful to find. Should have gone Kettering A&E and thats where we will go tomorrow. Disgraceful.

title: Amazing amazing care
body:
From being admitted in A&E, to triage, majors ward and then STU ward C1 all the staff are second to none. 

They are angels, without wings. The care they showed me and the other patients on my bay (bed 9) was heartfelt and unbelievable.

All the staff work so hard and deserve more recognition for what they all do. Every single person I came across introduced themselves to me and explained everything. 

Thank you xx

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Great facilities
body: I went to this clinic after being referred for a MRI and ultrasound and I had both done with in 5 weeks. This is a very nice professional  clinic very clean place and very friendly staff. I was very impressed

author: rach22
title: Amazing maternity care
body:
We want to say a massive thank you to the amazing staff at Daisy Hill hospital who delivered our baby girl safe and sound last week. From the theatre team who met us that morning, Aisling, Jacinta, Rachel, Colette and many more to the caring staff on the maternity ward after our baby arrived, Nicole, Iryana, Claire & Paula.  
This was our second experience in Daisy Hill and both times we have been blessed with amazing care which we will be forever thankful for!!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Brilliant service
body:
I had my 2nd Cataract Op on Sunday the 22/05/2022.
This eye hospital is excellent, all the staff are superb, from the young man who greeted me at the entrance to the surgeon, nurses etc the service could not have been better.
They are so quick and efficient, they are very friendly, polite and helpful.
I had my first op done at the Manchester spa Medica and they were good but Oldham was better, I was checked in, operated on and discharged all within 1 hour, it took nearly 4 hours at Manchester.
For anyone that’s referred to Spa Medica then don’t hesitate to go, you ont be disappointed.
Thank you Spa Medica for your wonderful service.👌😷.

author: Renal x 2
title: Care and compassion
body:
I have been attending BCH for many year's under the care of the renal team.  
Recently I have had to have a few admissions for intense treatment and I just want to say thank you to all the amazing staff on ward 11 South and at outpatients renal unit.  
These doctors and nurses go above and beyond and anytime I am an inpatient or there for an outpatients review/consultation their service is always first class. It is very clear to see that the multidisciplinary team work closely together and have excellent communication skills between themselves with regard to their patients and are always prepared and ready for each patient. They make me feel like I am their only patient at that moment in time.  
The fact that all the staff know you on first name terms makes things feel a little more relaxed.  
As I previously mentioned I have spend some time as an inpatient and I feel I wanted all the staff in 11 South to know that I appreciate every single thing they do for me. I would like to say a special thank you to Sr Karla, staff Nurses Emma, Diane and Ali but also auxiliaries Eimear and Agnes. I'd also like to say the biggest thank you to all the doctors but especially Dr Finn who truly goes above and beyond for me.  
You are an amazing team. Thank you for everything and keep up the amazing work.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: foxtrotcz93
title: Many could learn a lesson from this wonderful girl
body:
I was in the hospital with my son who was unwell and needed medical attention. My son suffers numerous health concerns and can be quite anxious.  
Nurse Laura was amazing, she reassured my son, made him feel at ease and respected, in a situation where he was embarrassed. The Dr. however, made my son feel like a waste of time due to his history with alcohol, making jokes about my sons big beer belly which was actually fluid! If it wasn't for Nurse Laura my son would have left the hospital without the medical treatment he needed and I don't bare to think what could have happened.  
Thank you Laura for showing so much care and compassion to my son, who feels always usually like a lesser person for history with alcohol. Many could learn a lesson from this wonderful girl.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: jiveqz54
title: Excellent Service
body:
I arrived at the clinic and was greeted by friendly reception staff. I visited to discuss going on PREP. The doctor was very polite reassuring explained the whole process asked lots of questions. My previous experience at a similar clinic was totally the opposite and had scared me a little from approaching for help. This doctor was totally the opposite.  
She sent me through to the nurse who was lovely. Whilst I wasn’t nervous with the tests she was so calm and reassuring and put you at ease.  
From start to finish the whole process was very relaxing. Friendly staff. I came away thinking these people felt like they enjoyed their jobs  
Couldn’t fault the service at all

title: Not What I Expected
body:
I have had 4 sessions with Trent PTS now and I'm not sure if it's helping me or not. I thought I could talk to a counsellor about my issues and thoughts and we would discuss them, manage and how to overcome them. Instead, I feel the counsellor does more of the talking and we work through worksheets to which I find all overwhelming. 

At the end of each session I am given to-do lists and smart goals for next sessions which are resources and worksheets to read. All I do is read through but I don't feel they help me any way, they make me more confused. We discuss about strategies in social anxiety situations but to read and look at worksheets I can't put them into real life situations. My counsellor has advised me to use the 54321 strategy and the 'worry tree' but I can't. I dread every session because at the end I feel like we've made no progress. I really don't know what to do or where to turn. I convince myself to stick with it and hopefully things will turn out but I'm really unsure about this and if this is helpful.

title: Fantastic team
body: Came in for a wisdom tooth removal was made to feel very welcome as soon as I arrived at the department, staff and surgeon were brilliant made me feel comfortable and reassured me around my surgery. All round brilliant team.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

author: Mummy546
title: Scary experience as a first time mummy
body: I just wanted to take this opportunity to thank all the midwives from fetal assessment, antenatal,  postnatal and the labour ward especially Barbara, Laura, Rebecca and Jennifer. Scary experience as a first time mummy and baby deciding to come 8 weeks early but these girls made it a positive experience. Thank you

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Extremely disappointed
body:
My 16yr son injured his wrist during PE lesson in school. Picked him up & went straight to A&E at Salford  Royal. Arrived just before  2pm. Waiting time was 3hrs for minor injuries. After 3 hrs it went to 6hrs. My son despite being in servere pain, and in the middle of his GCSE Exams with an English exam in the morning, is still at A&E  at 10:30 pm. 8 hours since he arrived and no treatment apart from pain relief.

Its shocking & totally unacceptable. 

We have pleaded with anyone for hours and watched patients come and go! 8 hours and no treatment!!!!!

Eith an exam at 9am tomorrow using an injured wrist!!!

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

author: Gerri
title: Help with decision-making
body: Had my last antenatal appointment with Dr. McDonald ... the nicest man I ever met. He made me feel so at ease and helped me with the right decision for Birth...xx

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Dedicated staff in Respiratory Medicine
body: I was referred to Warwick Hospital Cardiology then Respiratory departments. When initial tests revealed nothing, I began to develop doubts about my symptoms and was ready to give up, but my consultant in Respiratory Medicine ordered further extensive testing and persevered until successfully reaching a correct diagnosis. I am now back to full health and will be eternally grateful for the wonderful attention I was given, and for the warmth and approachability of the staff members involved in my care.

author: Whalesomething
title: Lovely staff
body: I was very nervous and uncomfortable, as I hadn't really had anything remotely similar happen to me before. I couldn't have asked for a nicer doctor. She made the experience a lot more comfortable for me, I felt very safe in her hands. The nurse was also lovely. She let me hold her hand whilst they put it in.

title: Efficient service and caring staff
body: My elderly father was referred by GP to see ENT surgeons - had to go to A&E first and the staff in Majors C were fantastic - nothing too much trouble even though they were obviously busy. My father had blood tests, chest X-ray, and medications given and surgeons informed. He was seen by the SHO who was very kind and asked for her registrar to review. Her registrar and the consultant saw my father very quickly and requested a CT scan which they arranged for the same afternoon. Although it was a long day - we arrived around 0945 and left just before 5 pm - my father was seen, investigated, had a diagnosis and a plan for follow up. As an NHS worker myself, I was really proud of how well organised the system was. I also know that staff work hard and do their best, but being on the patient side for once I really appreciated how it really is the little things - kind words, patience and a smile - which make such a difference. Would love to name the ENT junior doctors - they were delightful and a credit to the future of the NHS - but also the A&E nurses, receptionists, the lovely porter who found a blanket for my dad before wheeling him round the hospital, the security guard….thank you all.

readBy.name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Friendly practice
body:
Just want too say a big thankyou too the receptionist too the doctors ... i have always found these doctors are trustworthy and caring towards me with my problems lately...

Like the new phone system you know where u are in queue... 

Thankyou everyone for doing the most difficult job ...

author: Elizabth22
title: 10/10 care
body:
I was unexpectedly admitted via A&E to the acute receiving unit 9B for a general surgery. I must say all the staff from A&E to 9B to the theatre staff were fantastic. As a nurse myself I was always so anxious about what I’d be like or how I’d feel as a patient one day but the staff took fantastic care of me. So kind and attentive.  
I was nervous to go under GA but the theatre staff were so good they put me at ease. It’s quite clear all staff are under immense pressure but this did not affect their ability to care for me. Well done everyone

title: Very good surgery
body: Always helpful reception team, always able to get through after a while,have managed to speak to a doctor or seen a doctor all the way through the covid pandemic, Doctors always give the extra time when needed, I have never been disappointed with the care myself and my family have had ,been with this practice over 30 years

title: Great Appointment With Nurse
body:
Had my smear test yesterday, previously had many bad experiences at a different surgery which made me very anxious about having my next one, especially as I was new to this surgery.
Nurse was kind, patient, explained everything to me and listened to my concerns. Very reassuring and considering it can be quite uncomfortable and awkward experience, it was not and I have now had a positive experience which makes me feel much better about having such appointments.

title: Best Doctors ever
body: The Best Doctors ever. Always ready to help me and such lovely staff. Receptionists are amazing too. Would Highly recommend

title: Solid practice
body: Friendly and helpful team, good quality treatments, fast services ,huge attention to details. Highly recommending

title: Awful
body:
Long wait on phones before someone answers 
Appointments difficult to get -face to face and telephone consultations 
Don’t get calls back even when given date from econsult 
Don’t return calls 
No disbetic nurse 
Hard to get regular check ups for those with long term illnesses 
Always seem to be understaffed 
Lack of empathy or compassion and very rude 
Unable to provide answers when faced with challenges about reporting insufficient practices

author: moonjt99
title: Screening for cervical cancer
body:
I wanted to put a view across regarding screening for Gynae cancers. I feel there is improvements happening all the time to screening for cervical cancer which is fantastic.  
I would like to see staff trained in screening for all Gynae cancers whilst a patient attends for a smear test could the staff ask the patient about symptoms of pain, unusual bleeding, bloating or any symptoms that worry them. A lot of women don’t know to check themselves to monitor for vulva cancers or pre cancer cell lesions and this could also be very beneficial if staff also examine the patient’s whole vulva and not just swab the cervix.  
I feel the Gynae departments are extremely busy and these appointments could be very successful in early detection of a number of Gynae cancers, and overall improve on women’s health and relieve the pressure of the department. if staff doing smear tests followed a new protocol for a whole gynaecology health check at each appointment.

title: Phone system not working
body:
Start phone call 08.30.  Get through to queue approx 1 hour later phone answered to make appointment for phone all from doctor.  Keep day free waiting for 5 minute phone call at some time.  Incredibly unsatisfactory.  Likely to have call when doing something else so do not say all that you intended to say.
Advice from doctor is of little value.  Must be boring for doctor and sounds as if doc pretty uninterested.

author: Staffonbehalf
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: We never now what's round the corner.
body:
Hello,  
I had a good job, was a good Mum to 3 children, had a husband and lovely house full of love. Or so I thought.  
My story began over 3 years ago now, I've always been a social drinker from about age 15, just normal, a few drinks weekends, maybe more. Then over the last 3 years it crept up and up, without me really realising. Then it became a big problem, I couldn't function without drinking. I left my job, my relationships with family and friends declined. My main concern was alcohol, where and when I could get it. How did this happen to me. I could see no way out, I was in this dark place, on a conveyor belt, with no way off.  
I engaged with One Recovery Bucks through my doctor, I had a couple of keyworkers, but to be honest I wasn't engaging, I tried, but felt so awful, I kept drinking. Covid came, so no visits to centre. I had my new keyworker Manjinder, she could have given up on me, but she didn't. She kept pushing me and guiding me, making me realise, I could actually beat this somehow. Sadly my marriage was falling apart, my husband didn't understand alcoholism, he just thought it was my choice. (If only it was that easy). He took all the handles of every window, locked and padlocked doors and gates, so I could not leave home. I became like a rat, looking for alcohol. My despair was getting worse. I tried to take my life, there was no where I felt I belonged. I broke my kneecap trying to escape the home. I fell over and broke my arm, all due to alcohol. So so ashamed. Manjinder, still there supporting me, guiding me, believing in me. Eventually I engaged. My children always there, watching, waiting, caring, but helpless to what was happening to their Mother.  
I went away to a rehab called Betel in Derby. It's free, but you have to work 6 days a week within the charity to keep funds coming in to feed and clothe us all. We also all learnt a new trade to help us when moved on. I lived in a safe house with 11 girls and at the farm where we worked there was about 50 men. I learnt so much about myself, giving me inner strength (I call it my toolbox to deal with issues and thoughts). I received a letter, after 27 years of marriage, from my husband. He wanted a divorce. I was destroyed, I was sobre, trying to get better for myself and my family. The time at Betel to reflect to see the real me again, made me realise I could do this.  
I left rehab, and drank again, I was so destroyed about my marriage and then I found out about his affair. I didn't blame him, because I felt so worthless. I had let my family down completely. But who was there to support me, Manjinder, fighting me to gain control, you've got this, she would say. I ended up homeless, because my daughter was under 16, social services was involved, I had an altercation with my husband and I was arrested. No longer allowed in the family home we owned.  
Our wonderful government system kicked in. I was hospitalised for 3 weeks, I got a bug in my blood stream. Really could anything more happen? Outreach got involved with my care, as they found me homeless, connections then took over to support me finding a place to live. Manjinder still there, telling me, you've got this. Where would I be without these ladies in my life supporting me. I couldn't have done this alone. But equally, I couldn't have done it if I hadn't engaged with One Recovery to begin with and started to believe that I could beat this awful disease.  
Today Manjinder released me from her care. She feels it's time, another step forward, so now the recovery team will take over, and Connections still supporting me with housing and getting back to work. I'm currently volunteering. Every day, is a new day, which I look at with new eyes. I get overwhelmed very easily, so out comes my inner toolbox. Its a very lonely journey being an alcoholic, but even more lonely when you are sober with a clear head, but I feel so healthy and happy. Sadly in our society its normal to drink. I cannot ever risk having a drink again. I am adjusting my life, with new friends and watching the company I keep.  
I cannot begin to thank so many people for caring, believing, listening, understanding, never judging me. Ambulance staff, nurses, doctors, social workers, ORB, Connections, Betel, family and friends.  
I don't know how it all began, but its been a hard journey, I have learnt so much about myself and others. So it starts with being Openminded and engaging I suppose. One day at a time.  
I now can look forward to my future, to the person I am becoming. I want to help others who have been in this type of situation. We never now what's round the corner.

title: Fantastic staff - couldn’t fault any of them
body: Every single member of staff I came across as an Admission on the day patient at the gynaecology unit was so lovely, kind and professional - they couldn’t have been nicer and put me more at ease. They are a credit to the hospital. They made the whole process much less daunting and I couldn’t have asked for a better team to look after me! Thank you all so much.

author: errandre93
title: Kind and professional support
body:
Penny and Becky from ICATT North have supported one of our service users in the community following a serious physical illness . Both Penny and Becky have worked alongside our team to ensure this SU was able to return home safely and have been accessible and so supportive to our team .  
Both Penny and Becky are very kind, professional and have lovely people skills and their input was so valued by us and the service user . Thanks for all you support and hard work , the service user has now recovered and recently discharged and is doing brilliantly.

title: Great service
body:
After a fall which I cut my hand I telephoned to see if I could attend the injury clinic ( the person I spoke to was very welcoming) We attended and was greeted again with a very kind attitude, we didn’t have to wait very long ie 35 minutes 
The nurse removed all the grit from the injury very efficiently and dressed my hand. We found all this situation quite unusual as the hospitals in London would have taken at least 4 to 6 hours and they certainly wouldn’t have been as pleasant. So I would like to thank everyone there.

title: Good service
body: Slight phone que however worth the wait as problems are always solved quickly and efficiently. Friendly staff answering the phones.

title: Brilliant Care
body: I cannot thank all the staff enough that provided care to me following my recent bowel operation. B3 staff from the consultant to the domestic staff showed care, professionalism & patient respect throughout my hospital stays. Without their dedication I couldn’t have got through this traumatic personal experience. Your staff are a credit to the health profession. This was my first operation and I was scared but all the staff did everything they could to allay my worries & one member of staff escorted me to theatre holding my hand all the way to the anaesthetic room. That member of staff will never know how much that meant to me!!

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very good and swift service.
body: The service I have received from the Paramedic Advanced Practitioner, has always been and continues to be, OUTSTANDING.

author: Bob the old firemat
title: Advice from Urology team has made my life better
body:
I attended for a uroflowmetry test. The staff there were very understanding and above all treated me as a person and not another patient who had to be treated.  
I did have difficulty in passing urine, but was treated with dignity and was told that it wasn’t a problem which made me feel a lot happier. Rebecca, Ansu and sadly I cannot recall the name of the male nurse all were very professional and friendly.  
I was asked if I wanted to have a TURP but declined it. I was given some advice to alleviate the problem at night. I have followed their advice and it has made my life better. A great team who are a credit to the NHS.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Superb Customer Care
body: As a glaucoma patient I wish to extend my thanks and gratitude to all members of the glaucoma team at QMC. They are all caring and supportive and display great professionalism.

title: Ports Down group
body: Once again i have treied for the last 2 weeks ervery morning to see a doctor and most of the time being on Hold from 8 am with 50 people in the que before me and then all the appointment are gone Is a joke Posts down Group are a joke

title: Great care
body: Having wrestled with phone and online services to get some sort of communication, I was delighted to get a face-to-face appointment today. The receptionist was charming and helpful (at 8am!) and I could not have hoped for more care, concern and attention than I received from the doctor. One happy patient! I would always recommend this practice, if only your methods of communication were on a par with your staff!

title: Lovely staff
body: Yesterday I had a lesion removed and from start to finish the staff made me feel so at ease, so friendly. I cannot praise them enough what a brilliant "team".Well done to all of you ,feel proud.

title: Superb team of doctors and support staff
body: I have been with this practise for more than two decades. On the several occasions I have seen a doctor at this practise I have without exception received first class treatment, understanding and care and cannot think of any occasion that I was left feeling that something had been missed or not explained properly. On each occasion my medical condition was addressed thoroughly and thoughtfully.

title: Awful practice
body: I have only been in Birmingham for some months and I have never been to such a terrible doctors practice. On all occasions I’ve called and made an appointment there has been a problem. With the receptionists giving me the wrong dates for appointments on most times and then telling me that it’s my fault. Not listening and telling me I had booked a telephone appointment only to be told I’d missed it because it was a face to face, getting the dates mixed up then having to wait weeks for another appointment. For one issue I had to wait 6 weeks to talk to someone because my appointment was cancelled on the day and I had already waited three weeks. Then when I have been in waiting for over 40 minutes after my allotted time. Additionally one of the male doctors is extremely rude, uncaring and doesn’t listen or seem to have any time for whatever the problem is. So now I have asked to not be placed with him. I am very close to leaving. I have honestly never experienced such a bad doctors practice.

title: Great Practice
body:
Myself and my son have been there and the staff have always been so polite, helpful and every time contacting the Surgery they have always got in contact quickly and the Matter has been dealt with. No time waiting or any problems dealing with my requests. Can’t praise this surgery enough & being under pressure with a these uncertain times as well. 
People are always quick enough to moan and not give praise where is deserved.
Thank you all the staff & Drs at the surgery.

title: Incredibly helpful and kind
body: The team at Northenden group practice are exceptional. They always have time and are caring and considerate. At present I ve been having to call the practice on numerous occasions fir help with mum. The team have gone above and beyond helping facilitate our family needs and appointments. I can't praise the team any more highly.  Thank you .

title: Amazing Medical Support
body: My family and I have been fortunate enough to have worked and lived in many different countries around the world, from the USA to the Kingdom of Bahrain. With that being said, we have experienced many different medical practices and surgeries. Without a doubt, the Wetherby Surgery is at the top of all the practices we have received medical services from. The staff is courteous, professional, knowledgeable and empathetic. They strive to diagnose and treat your ailment quickly, so that you can get back to your life as soon as possible. Thank you for taking such good care of my family’s health over the last year.

title: Midwives House
body: In recent years I have had some bad experiences with the NHS ranging from simply not great to traumatisingly bad. However the women at Midwives House have been absolutely exceptional. Kind, understanding and thorough in my care, they have been wonderful. From front of house to doctors to every midwife I have seen they have provided exceptional care and incredible kindness. They deserve recognition and thanks for their important work and for all excelling in their individual roles. Thank you so much.

author: Popmc48
title: Professional, kind and caring paramedics
body:
My husband sadly passed away in mid May 2022.  
The two paramedics who attended at my home were just so professional kind and caring. I cannot express my sincere thanks to them for everything they did that morning both for my husband and also for me.  
They are and will be true angels in my eyes. Thank you again Colin and David.

title: Fabulous practice, for me 5 star rating
body: I couldn't be happier with this practice. My two grown-up daughters and husband belong to this practice.   I would highly recommend Wentworth. They have been under so much pressure in the last couple of years with covid 19 but have always been able to help me with my own going health condition, Well done Wentworth.

title: Clueless
body:
Difficult to truly find the words for how unfit this place is to deal with the health of local people.  It's almost impossible to get an appointment unless you can afford to wait two weeks or more. The reception staff range from confused, rude, unhelpful and clueless. It never feels like they actually want to help, they just want you off the phone. My partner is pregnant but that information doesn't seem to install any urgency in the attempt to find an appointment. Phone waiting times are often 45 minutes or more - after which you get put through to an extremely unhelpful person who doesn't listen and wants you off the phone. I understand that the pandemic put an enormous strain on the NHS but surely by now - May 2022 - it should be possible to get a physical appointment rather than being forced to fill out an e-consult form which often confuses and fails to work.
Once you actually get through to a medical professional they are all excellent so this negative review relates entirely to the reception staff and the operating systems.  I fear that my baby - due later this year - will rely on this incompetent practice for local and urgent healthcare needs.

title: Excellent care and prompt diagnosis
body: I was diagnosed with a complex condition by my gp who did thorough tests and listened carefully and asked many questions. He started me on the correct treatment and withing days my quality of life has improved so much I cant thank them enough. I never feel fobbed off ,im always listened to and taken seriously. He made a follow up appt one week later to see how I was and explained my condition and everything I needed to know. I've been with this surgery for 4 yrs and always found them to be excellent.

title: Can't get appointment for 3 year old
body: I've been trying to get an appointment for my 3 year old, but each time I call the line is either full and the line hangs up, or they say no appointments available. Honestly don't know how I'm going to get my daughter to see a GP?

author: JohnC22
title: Bereavement support
body: My mother, father, sister and best friend all passing away within a short period of time. I felt numb, lost and incomplete when my best mate died.

author: Dorothy1969
title: I lost my mum and the grief I felt was overwhelming
body:
I lost my mum and the grief I felt was overwhelming to me. I had anxiety attacks -broken sleep and what I can only describe as deep grief at her loss.  
I felt like something had broken in me physically and mentally. I was referred to bereavement therapy and as I have never had therapy before I was unsure what would happen. The therapist I was referred to was wonderful and listened and talked in all the right places. Our sessions are now over as of today but she has referred me to other services for which I am very grateful.  
The day my mum passed was life changing for me as it opened up and closed doors for me that I am still trying to come to terms with.  
The 6 sessions offered are I know are the bench mark to help people but I feel if the therapist was given a little leeway with that, that may help as no one persons grief is the same.  
That being said I am grateful to the service and the therapist I was given in particular.  
My grief is still there with me everyday and it is still deep feeling . I am hoping that the referrals I have will be a continuance of the start I had with the bereavement service.

author: Rosiefife
title: Early Cancer Diagnosis Centre
body:
in early January 2022 I contacted the Doctor's surgery and spoke with the Nurse Practitioner about my problem. Painful thighs when I lie on my side, left and right, in bed at night. This had been ongoing for some months and I was now needing to find out what it was. My husband told me to tell them about my weight loss too. Bloods were taken a few days later and I handed in a poo sample.  
When the results came back the bloods were normal, however, the poo sample had blood traces. The Nurse Practitioner informed me that he would refer me to the local hospital for further investigation, due to my unexplained weight loss. Also, I may not be contacted straight away as the hospitals are very busy.  
Imagine my surprise, when the next day I received a phone call from the ECDC (Early Cancer Diagnosis Centre). Lifestyle questions were answered and I was informed about the next step with the ECDC. I received appointment details for a CT scan toward the end of January, at Queen Margaret, Dunfermline and a Results appointment at the beginning of February, at Victoria Hospital, Kirkcaldy.  
It was like a whirlwind, not of destruction/confusion, but reassurance and comfort. Everything happened quickly, in a very organised way, giving me confidence that the people who would be caring for me knew what they were doing and would be there of me.  
More bloods were taken and the CT scan was done. I was contacted the following day by Katie - ECDC nurse - who informed me that the only issue they had was in my lungs. They were passing me over to Chest Department for clarification.  
So, in early February I had my appointment with Katie who checked my legs over and informed me she would try and arrange an Ultra Sound to ascertain the problem. My appointment with the Chest department was also that same day, in the afternoon. Mr McKenzie reviewed the CT scan sharing the details with me, not only of the recent scan but the first one I had taken. This showed an improvement in the overall condition of my lungs but highlighted the need for further investigation of an ongoing health problem I have with my lungs.  
Amazingly, in less than four weeks I had been assessed for cancer and was clear. What a relief!  
Everyone I came in contact with as very kind and took time with me. It was also a great privilege for me to have been a part of the ECDC Pilot.  
I have since been for an Ultra Sound and there is nothing to worry about.  
Please pass on my kindest regards to Lorna - Pathway Navigator and Katie CNS (Clinical Nurse Specialist) ECDC Team, who were my points of contact and kept me informed and gave me confidence through this situation.  
My grateful thanks,

author: sculptorez56
title: Most helpful service
body:
NHS Mood Management  
The Service has been most helpful. Our leader on the course is excellent and the mood management programme has been so helpful.

readBy.name: East Ayrshire Health and Social Care Partnership

author: whisperkm97
title: Down to earth service
body:
NHS Mood Management - CMHTE Kilmarnock  
Right- Speak in down to earth terms.  
Lets us know we are not alone and the future holds hope in ways to look after ourselves. Good at listening.  
Janet is an excellent tutor.

readBy.name: East Ayrshire Health and Social Care Partnership

author: robinrn56
title: I have learned quite a lot in this mood management course
body: I have learned quite a lot in this 6 week course. I have learned how to control my anxiety and depression with different skills. I have been with a very good leader and a group of lovely ladies. I have learned that I may still become anxious or depressed but hopefully will have the necessary skills to cope.

readBy.name: East Ayrshire Health and Social Care Partnership

author: blackbirdkc76
title: Everything I asked for
body:
Most things put in place - everything discussed put in place.  
Team done really well, have received everything asked for.  
Everyone involved very helpful.

readBy.name: East Ayrshire Health and Social Care Partnership

author: charaqk57
title: Enjoyed the company
body: Enjoyed the course of Mood Management. Found the homework a bit difficult. Was apprehensive to begin with. I had never been on a group meeting before. After a few sessions felt better and enjoyed the company of the other attendees.

readBy.name: East Ayrshire Health and Social Care Partnership

author: Glaca22
title: Positive, informative and very person-centred.
body:
I attended my appointment with gynaecology a few weeks ago. Due to the intimate nature of examinations, I felt nervous while in the waiting room. Hayley, the nurse on duty came to the waiting room to say hi and record our names. Her friendly demeanor helped me feel more settled.  
Following this, Dr Mackay met me in the corridor and walked with me towards the treatment room while introducing herself and informing me of the upcoming process. This was incredibly helpful as I felt reassured and appreciated the fact that she did spend a few minutes with me prior to the examination. Following examination, Dr Mackay answered some of my questions and outlined my options moving forward. I did feel emotionally held in the process, sufficient time was dedicated to the appointment and the treatment from both the doctor and nurse was positive, informative and very person-centred.  
I'm thankful of the care I received by the above mentioned health care professionals.

author: Postage
title: Potential patient safety risk
body:
I received a Royal Mail delivery card advising a fee to pay for something they had tried to deliver on 14th May 2022, normally I would ignore anything like this but on this occasion I was expecting a parcel from a friend in Switzerland and thought it could be they had under paid the postage.  
I paid the £2.50 fee for delivery and waited for the item to be re delivered, it arrived on Wednesday 18th May, but it wasn’t the parcel I was expecting but an appointment for breast screening.  
My concern isn’t the £2.50 but more if I hadn’t paid I may have missed a valuable appointment, and more importantly how many other letters have gone out to others with no postage paid.  
I have brought this to your attention as I feel that this is a patient safety risk and some people may get missed for this vital and essential service which as we know early diagnosis is essential for treatment.  
I hope you understand why I felt it important to bring to someone’s attention.  
Thanks

title: Telephone appointments
body: I had a phone appointment today which was excellent. The GP listened to my concerns and symptoms and asked questions. He explained clearly what was happening and why, so that I fully understood, before prescribing treatment. The service from the receptionists and doctors was very prompt and effective. Some patients are concerned about the difference today in how we relate to our doctors but this was a reassuring example of a new practice.

author: Gmom
title: Highgate Centre bad experience, didnt feel safe.
body:
I have been sectioned at Highgate Centre now 3 times every time so bad staff I met aggressive except one nurse and another woman who i dont think is qualified but she trys and says sorry to us all the time.  
all the other nurses I have seen on this ward seem so cruel, shouting at patients who are unwell. why arent they kind why arent they sitting down talk to women sectioned there why they all so rude? not all of these really bad nurses are agency there are ones there every time i been admitted. the men staff frighten me. lots of women and the men who come to restrain for no reason Ican see. its very very frightening they pin me down on my front pushed on me so hard i couldnt breathe and threw me in my room then injected me and left me. no nurses checked at all after and i had very bad headache and blury eyes and couldnt breathe. they did this because i didnt want to take tablet that was new and they refuse to explain why was given and law says they have to explain my cpn says.  
why they so nasty to patients when they could talk instead but i dont think they know how to and seem to hate their jobs. they just shout and frighten me and lots of women and they threat us all the time they will restrain and inject instead of talk like we are humans. these are not nurses like at hospitals that arent mental health i never been treated this bad when in other hospitals. there is something very wrong i always think it would be better to be in prison it would be safer and I think the nurses in charge are as bad because they know this it is in front of their eyes and it makes women very ill and it is cruel thing to so .When we are ill patients and they do this we get more ill and i saw lots of times women hurt themselves try kill themselves on this ward and i been there 3 times now and never gets better.  
where do they get these nurses from and my cpn read me and showed me other people wrote here say lots same about staff and very frightened patients . my community team say they dont want me to go there anymore but crisis team never comes to me so i have to and am sectioned.

readBy.name: Camden and Islington NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful GP
body: My GP today was considerate and understanding and I can ask for no more than that. Please pass on my thanks.

author: Relxw86
title: He received a very high standard of medical intervention.
body:
My father availed of this service last week for 5 days, his second experience in 10 months. He is in his mid eighties and active.  
The dedication of Dr Khan and the nursing team has been invaluable to Dad and us as a family, enabling us to look after him at home whilst he received a very high standard of medical intervention. Their support, their access to diagnostic results and speed of decisions regarding changes to treatment on a daily basis is such a professional operation. We were informed at every stage and as the team come to the family home we never feel we are being a bother to them whereas in a busy ward it's maybe not always possible to speak to the Dr. With hospital at home our experience has been very satisfactory and our preferred approach for both out elderly parents. It's a service which has so much potential for families who's loved ones want to be looked after in their homes, especially during covid when visiting was restricted but as a model of care going forward it is an important service to build upon.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: papasmurf573
title: Podiatry service saved my leg
body: I got a vein bypass on in December 2021. I was told in February 2022 that they wanted to remove my leg either below knee or above knee. I met a girl in Lurgan podiatry unit, her name was Clare. She worked wonders and saved my leg. It started off by taking ulcers on my toes. The ulcers are gone. I owe that girl a hell of a lot

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Remarkable.
body:
I've been a patient at Westgate surgery for many years, experiencing good medical care.
When the practice changed hands, a few years ago there was negative feedback in the town. They obviously responded to this and steady changes and improvements were made.

Then Covid hit hard.
The whole Westgate team were ready and their response was remarkable!
The best medical pratice in the area.

author: nuthatchsc66
title: They have been devoted to her care
body:
My Aunt has been in the care of the renal unit for the past two years and from her very first appointment they have been devoted to her care.  
It has been like being in the care of family. Mr Hardy, Dympna, Joan and the rest of the team have been super. She was recently an inpatient in the hospital and they liaised with her family, provided support and attended to my Aunt with compassionate care. We cannot thank you enough for all you have done.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: ED0208
title: All the staff we saw were so good
body:
Attended Altnagelvin A&E with my 6 year old son as he jammed his finger in a door. It was an extremely busy evening so there was a wait which was expected.  
Hannah triaged him and was so lovely. Dr Connor was so good and reassuring, and great with my son. Once he saw us he ensured we were seen to and treated. He also got an appointment for us to attend Dundonald to see plastics team on the Friday.  
Just wanted to say that all the staff we saw were so good and I am sorry I don't know all their names.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
